snippet: The power to invalidate legislation is the ultimate political power, and those mortals who exercise it need constraint. So why not have term limits for the highest court in the land?
abstract: Op-Ed article by Duke law prof Paul D Carrington contends that if the Supreme Court overturns the Affordable Care Act, Congress should consider using its constitutional power, as it has in the past, to add two more justices, and to impose a reasonable age limit on judicial service; holds such a shift would help temper the long-term ideological swings that have become common on the modern court.
